column4: Can someone tell me why the Ubuntu installer would fail at resizing the partitions?
I used the Ubuntu installers GUI for selecting partition sizes and it showed the Windows Vista partition, but when I tried to install Ubuntu along side vista, it failed to resize the partition
ok, I'm going to bring up Gparted
I'm on the live USB right now
if you resize vista far enough it will want a auto chkdsk probably be prepared for that.
how mant=y windows partitons do you see?
you can only have a maxium of 4 promary partitions.
or 3 primaries and a extended, for logical partitions for ubuntu.
are you counting the unallocated as a partition?
cool make sure you put a exteneded in the unallocated, then logicals inside the extended.
take a screen shot of gparted and imagbin it.
http://imagebin.org/index.php?page=add
I yink you probably need to run a chkdsk on that
yeah chkdsk /f/r
make sure your defragged as well, how much data is in sda3?
not without gparted being able to read it, be careful here you could damage the vista without following a protocol.
good idea. :D
you don't know the desktops?
so your question really is can you install kde is this correct if so yes.
yes, can I install KDE on 11.04?

so when you start to mix desktops they can have overlapping apps, and the desktop can be difficult to remove that you have added if you don't like it, personally I would download a kubuntu version of natty and check it out first. With natty being tied to compiz I think you can just install kubuntu but not sure of the consequences overall.
well, thanks for that nice bit of info
in the bot link is the wiki for ones that work.
